newsitem.title: JAPAN: Shimizu sees 96/97 prnt net prft below 10 bln yen.
newsitem.headline: Shimizu sees 96/97 prnt net prft below 10 bln yen.

text.p: Shimizu Corp said on Friday it expects to post a parent net profit of less than 10 billion yen for its 1996/97 business year, which ended on March 31.
The construction company also said it expects an appraisal loss of 8.6 billion yen on its securities holdings in 1996/97.
The company said in a statement it does not expect major changes in parent sales or current profit for 1996/97.
The statement also said it expected to pay an annual dividend of nine yen per share, as it had forecast.
